data.title: 2000s romantic drama film stubs
data.text:
1.

Noksaek uija

2005 South Korean film

Overview: Green Chair (녹색 의자 - Noksaek uija) is a South Korean film directed by Park Chul-soo, that was released in 2005. It is about an affair between an attractive thirty-two-year-old woman and a youth just short ...

Release date: 1 January 2005

Genre: Romance, Drama

Director: Cheol-su Park

Producer: Jeong-ho Lee

When an ordinary housewife is convicted for seducing a minor, reckless love leads to obsession and creeping doubt.

0 0

Baler

2008 Filipino film

Overview: Baler is a 2008 drama film and the official entry of VIVA Films in the 2008 Metro Manila Film Festival, starring Anne Curtis and Jericho Rosales. Its first screening was on December 25, 2008, simultaneously ...

0 0

3.

Lorna Doone

British TV series or programme

Overview: Lorna Doone is a British romance/drama television movie version of Richard Doddridge Blackmore's novel of the same name and aired on BBC One from 24 to 26 December 2000 in the UK and on A&E on 11 March ...

0 0

5.

Kiss Me Again

2006 American film

Overview: Kiss Me Again is a 2006 romantic drama film directed and co-written by William Tyler Smith. It stars Jeremy London and Katheryn Winnick.

0 0

6.

Griffin & Phoenix

2006 American film

Overview: Griffin & Phoenix is a 2006 American romance film produced by Gold Circle Films, starring Dermot Mulroney and Amanda Peet. It is a remake of the 1976 film Griffin and Phoenix. Since 2007, the film remake ...

Release date: 12 September 2006

Genre: Comedy, Drama, Romance

Director: Ed Stone

Writer: John Hill

GRIFFIN AND PHOENIX is a poignantly funny love story about two people who face a seemingly insurmountable obstacle that may stand between them and a last ...

0 0

7.

All My Life

2004 Filipino film

Overview: All My Life is 2004 Filipino romantic drama film directed by Laurenti M. Dyogi and starring Aga Muhlach and Kristine Hermosa.

Release date: 26 May 2004

Genre: Drama, Romance

Director: Laurenti Dyogi

Sam and Louie meet on a cruise and become friends. Later they meet again and recognize their love for each other.

0 0

8.

Aap Mujhe Achche Lagne Lage

2002 film by Vikram Bhatt

Overview: Aap Mujhe Achche Lagne Lage (transl.) is a 2002 Indian Hindi romance action drama film directed by Vikram Bhatt, starring Hrithik Roshan and Ameesha Patel. To date, it is the only film in which Hrithik ...

Release date: 19 April 2002

Genre: Drama, Romance, Action

Director: Vikram Bhatt

The daughter of a rich criminal industrial tycoon falls in love with a college boy. The tycoon, what a surprise, objects...

0 0

9.

The Great Gatsby

2000 television film by Robert Markowitz

Overview: The Great Gatsby is a 2000 British-American romantic drama television film, based on the 1925 novel of the same name by F. Scott Fitzgerald. It stars Toby Stephens in the title role of Jay Gatsby, Mira ...

Release date: 29 March 2000

Genre: Drama, Romance

Director: Robert Markowitz

Stock broker Nick Carraway consents to play Cupid for his rich married cousin Daisy Buchanan and her former love, nouveau riche Jay Gatsby.

0 0

10.

Carolina Moon

American TV series or program

Overview: Carolina Moon is a 2007 American television film directed by Stephen Tolkin and starring Claire Forlani and Oliver Hudson. Based on the Nora Roberts novel Carolina Moon, the film is about a woman with ...

Release date: 19 February 2007

Genre: Drama, Thriller, Romance, Mystery

Director: Stephen Tolkin

A woman who has psychic visions returns to her hometown to exorcise her demons, and finds both danger and love.

13.

The Soul Keeper

2002 film

Overview: The Soul Keeper (Italian: Prendimi l'anima, French: L'âme en jeu) is a 2002 Italian-French-British romance-drama film directed by Roberto Faenza. It is loosely based on real life events of Russian psy ...

Release date: 27 September 2002

Genre: Drama, War, Romance, Biography

Director: Roberto Faenza

Seduced by Jung, killed by hate, redeemed by history. In 1905 a 19-year-old Russian girl suffering from...

The Price of Milk

2000 film by Harry Sinclair

Overview: The Price of Milk is a 2000/2001 Australian/New Zealand/American romantic fantasy film. It was directed by New Zealand actor and director Harry Sinclair.

0 0

Tart

2001 film by Christina Wayne

Overview: Tart is a 2001 American coming of age film written and directed by Christina Wayne and starring Dominique Swain, Bijou Phillips, and Brad Renfro. It follows a young woman at a preparatory school in 1980s ...

Release date: 15 June 2001

Genre: Drama, Romance, Crime

Director: Christina Wayne

Writer: Christina Wayne

A portrait of the increasingly desperate attempts of a teenage Manhattan girl to find love and kinship, in a world that never reciprocates.

Sylvia

2003 British film

Overview: Sylvia is a 2003 British biographical drama film directed by Christine Jeffs and starring Gwyneth Paltrow, Daniel Craig, Jared Harris, and Michael Gambon. It tells a story based on the real-life romance ...

Release date: 17 October 2003

Genre: Biography, Drama, Romance

Director: Christine Jeffs

Writer: John Brownlow

Story of the relationship between poets Edward James "Ted" Hughes and Sylvia Plath.

2003 film

Overview: Remember Me, My Love (Ricordati di me) is a 2003 Italian movie directed by Gabriele Muccino.

Release date: 11 February 2003

Genre: Comedy, Romance, Drama

Director: Gabriele Muccino

In the dysfunctional Italian middle-class family Ristuccia, the middle-aged executive Carlo has a stalled life without passion...

Passion of Mind

2000 American film

Overview: Passion of Mind is a 2000 American psychological romantic drama film starring Demi Moore. It was the first English-language film from Belgian director Alain Berliner, best known for the arthouse success ...

Release date: 7 January 2000

Genre: Romance, Drama, Mystery

Director: Alain Berliner

A psychological romantic thriller where fantasy and reality become indistinguishable for a woman leading a double life in her dreams.

Nina's Heavenly Delights

2006 British film by Pratibha Parmar

Overview: Nina's Heavenly Delights is a 2006 British drama Romance comedy film, directed by Pratibha Parmar. The film was released on 29 September 2006 in the United Kingdom, and on 21 November 2007 in the United ...

Release date: 28 September 2006

Genre: Comedy, Drama

Director: Pratibha Parmar

A feisty young woman returns to Glasgow to run her deceased father's curry house.
